property.name: text
property.value:
A simple demo for the ScarabWayptPublisher accessor. This accessor connects sets up a web socket and connects to rosbridge server, running on Scarab's ROS host.
The accessor takes in the following 3 inputs: 1. address (string) of rosbridge, eg: "localhost" or "127.0.0.1" 2. port (number) of rosbridge, eg: 9090 3. position (array of 2 floats: {x, y})
The connection has been verified over localhost and IPv4.
In this demo, the position coordinates are provided by the 'values' parameter in DiscreteClock. The websocket publishes this waypt to the '/goal' topic via rosbridge. It also publishes the final orientation for the robot in quartenion coordinates. This is hardcoded to (x , y, z, w) = (0, 0, 0, 1) for now. This makes Scarab turn to its original orientation (facing the x-axis).
To make Scarab cycle between (0, 0) and (5, 0), configure the DiscreteClock as follows: Period: 20 Offset: {0.0, 10.0} Values:{{0.0, 0.0}, {2.0, 0.0}}

property.name: script
description
property.value: This accessor publishes waypoints to the Scarab robot through a web socket. ROS running on the Scarab connects to the web socket through rosbridge. The inputs are an array of 2 floats, {x, y}. When wrapup() is invoked, this accessor closes the connection.

property.name: error (port)
property.value: The error message if an error occurs. If this port is not connected and an error occurs, then an exception is thrown instead.

property.name: server (port-parameter)
property.value: The IP address or domain name of the server.

property.name: port (port-parameter)
property.value: The port that the web socket server listens to.
